org.apache.edgent.connectors.iotp

Class IotpDevice

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.edgent.connectors.iotp.IotpDevice
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IotDevice, TopologyElement

    public class IotpDevice
extends java.lang.Object
implements IotDevice
    Connector for IBM Watson IoT Platform.
    IBM Watson IoT Platform is a cloud based internet of things scale message hub that provides a device model on top of MQTT. IotpDevice implements the generic device model IotDevice and thus can be used as a connector for IotProvider.
    Note IBM Watson IoT Platform was previously known as IBM Internet of Things Foundation.
    See Also:
    Edgent generic device model, IBM Watson IoT Platform, Sample application

    • Constructor Detail

      • IotpDevice

        public IotpDevice(Topology topology,
                  java.util.Properties options)
        Create a connector to the IBM Watson IoT Platform Bluemix service with the device specified by options.
        These properties must be set in options.
        • org=organization identifier
        • type=device type
        • id=device identifier
        • auth-method=token
        • auth-token=authorization token
        For example: 
         
 Properties options = new Properties();
 options.setProperty("org", "uguhsp");
 options.setProperty("type", "iotsample-arduino");
 options.setProperty("id", "00aabbccde03");
 options.setProperty("auth-method", "token");
 options.setProperty("auth-token", "AJfKQV@&bBo@VX6Dcg");
 
 IotDevice iotDevice = new IotpDevice(options);

        Connecting to the server occurs when the topology is submitted for execution.

        Parameters:
        options - control options
        topology - the connector's associated Topology.

      • IotpDevice

        public IotpDevice(Topology topology,
                  java.io.File optionsFile)
        Create a connector to the IBM Watson IoT Platform Bluemix service. Device identifier and authorization are specified by a configuration file.
        The format of the file is: 
         
 [device]
 org = organization identifier
 type = device type
 id = device identifier
 auth-method = token
 auth-token = authorization token
        For example: 
         
 [device]
 org = uguhsp
 type = iotsample-arduino
 id = 00aabbccde03
 auth-method = token
 auth-token = AJfKQV@&bBo@VX6Dcg

        Connecting to the server occurs when the topology is submitted for execution.

        Parameters:
        topology - the connector's associated Topology.
        optionsFile - File containing connection information.

    • Method Detail

      • quickstart

        public static IotpDevice quickstart(Topology topology,
                                    java.lang.String deviceId)
        Create an IotpDevice connector to the Quickstart service. Quickstart service requires no-sign up to use to allow evaluation but has limitations on functionality, such as only supporting device events and only one message per second.
        Parameters:
        topology - the connector's associated Topology.
        deviceId - Device identifier to use for the connection.
        Returns:
        Connector to the Quickstart service.
        See Also:
        Quickstart, Quickstart sample application

      • events

        public TSink<com.google.gson.JsonObject> events(TStream<com.google.gson.JsonObject> stream,
                                                Function<com.google.gson.JsonObject,java.lang.String> eventId,
                                                UnaryOperator<com.google.gson.JsonObject> payload,
                                                Function<com.google.gson.JsonObject,java.lang.Integer> qos)
        Publish a stream's tuples as device events.

        Each tuple is published as a device event with the supplied functions providing the event identifier, payload and QoS from the tuple. The event identifier and Quality of Service can be generated based upon the tuple.

        Specified by:
        events in interface IotDevice
        Parameters:
        stream - Stream to be published.
        eventId - function to supply the event identifier.
        payload - function to supply the event's payload.
        qos - function to supply the event's delivery Quality of Service.
        Returns:
        TSink sink element representing termination of this stream.
        See Also:
        QoS

      • events

        public TSink<com.google.gson.JsonObject> events(TStream<com.google.gson.JsonObject> stream,
                                                java.lang.String eventId,
                                                int qos)
        Publish a stream's tuples as device events.

        Each tuple is published as a device event with fixed event identifier and QoS.

        Specified by:
        events in interface IotDevice
        Parameters:
        stream - Stream to be published.
        eventId - Event identifier.
        qos - Event's delivery Quality of Service.
        Returns:
        TSink sink element representing termination of this stream.
        See Also:
        QoS

      • commands

        public TStream<com.google.gson.JsonObject> commands(java.lang.String... commands)
        Create a stream of device commands as JSON objects. Each command sent to the device matching commands will result in a tuple on the stream. The JSON object has these keys:
        • command - Command identifier as a String
        • tsms - Timestamp of the command in milliseconds since the 1970/1/1 epoch.
        • format - Format of the command as a String
        • payload - Payload of the command
          • If format is json then payload is JSON corresponding to the command specific data.
          • Otherwise payload is String
        Specified by:
        commands in interface IotDevice
        Parameters:
        commands - Commands to include. If no commands are provided then the stream will contain all device commands.
        Returns:
        Stream containing device commands.
